rules.name: NO_NEW_FILES
rules.description: Only edit existing files unless explicitly asked to create new ones. Always search for and modify existing files first.

rules.name: SEMANTIC_SEARCH_FIRST
rules.description: Use search_code with semantic patterns to find relevant files before reading. Always search recursively across directories.

rules.name: READ_FULL_CONTEXT
rules.description: Always read the entire file before modifying to understand structure, imports, and dependencies.

rules.name: EXPLAIN_BEFORE_TOOLS
rules.description: Always explain WHY you're calling a tool before using it. Be transparent about your reasoning.

rules.name: CHECK_GIT_STATUS
rules.description: Check git status before making changes to understand current branch and uncommitted changes.

rules.name: USE_FEATURE_BRANCHES
rules.description: Always create a new feature branch before making code changes. Never work on main, master, develop, or dev.

rules.name: PROACTIVE_FILE_EXPLORATION
rules.description: When user mentions a file name, immediately search for it using semantic search patterns. Don't assume it's in a specific location.

rules.name: TOOL_TRANSPARENCY
rules.description: Before calling any tool, explain what you're looking for and why. Example: 'I need to find Agents.tsx to shorten agent names. Searching in src directory...'

rules.name: READ_RELATED_FILES
rules.description: When modifying a file, check for related files (imports, exports, components that use it) to avoid breaking dependencies.

rules.name: COMMIT_AFTER_CHANGES
rules.description: After making changes, commit them with descriptive messages and push to the feature branch.

find_file.description: When user mentions a file, use search_code with pattern like 'filename|FileName' and search in appropriate directory

modify_file.description: Search → Read → Modify → Show changes. Always follow this sequence.

debug_issue.description: Search for error messages, check git history, read relevant files, identify root cause
